main event: On August 6, 1965, a pilot on the ground at Whiteman Air Force Base in Missouri observed an unidentified object in the sky that was described as circular in shape and emitting a bright light, with an estimated diameter of approximately 1 mile.
interesting points: On April 22, 1952, a trainee navigator in the control tower at Whiteman AFB observed an unidentified flying object on the radarscope that remained stationary for about 1 minute before accelerating at an extremely high rate of speed and disappearing.

On August 6, 1965, a bright light was observed in the sky by the duty officer and duty airman at Whiteman AFB, which appeared to be changing shape, size, and intensity, and at one point split into two separate lights before rejoining.

On August 6, 1965, a radar operator at Whiteman AFB observed an unidentified target on the radar scope that appeared circular in shape with a diameter of approximately 1/2 mile and moved erratically at a speed estimated to be over 1,000 knots.

On August 7, 1965, Lt Col Henry R Zink observed a bright white, round-shaped object hovering silently at an estimated altitude of 3,000 feet over Whiteman AFB for 5-10 minutes before suddenly accelerating and disappearing.

On August 6, 1965, a security police sergeant observed a bright, circular object in the northwest sky that was self-luminous and hovered or traveled at a very slow speed for about 45 minutes before suddenly accelerating and disappearing.
sighted object: circular objects, bright lights, unidentified targets on radar
photographs: yes, the report includes photographs and radar scope images
